pros: Amazing work enviroment and the opportunity to work and get involved with the community
cons: I don’t have any cons at the moment

job_title: Early Intervention Specialist in Austin, TX
pros: Flexible with schedule, not the best support from leadership
cons: Below average training. Low employee morale.

review_title: In-Home Care is Difficult, Managers Have Unrealistic Expectations
pros: Flexible work environment, work feels meaningful at times
cons: Management has unrealistic expectations for contacts with clients who may cancel, as well as with contacts for networking with other professionals/agencies. Clients are all over, I once drove from Leander to San Marcos for two client appointments in one day. You are expected to spend weekends at booths at various community events passing out flyers and signing people up. The pay is abysmal for someone with a Master's degree. Little actual training given in how to perform the job.

job_title: Human Resources Business Partner HRBP in Austin, TX
pros:
Value Employees
Great Benefits
Flexibility
Best Place to Work for Working Parents
cons:
Small Organization
Non-Profit
Compensation
They are great overall!

pros:
Direct service providers are passionate and deeply believe in the mission. They are wonderful to work with and are the backbone of the organization. 

Lots of flexibility
cons:
Like another poster wrote, some of the leadership creates a toxic work environment 

-using non-person centered language
-retaliating against staff if they are disagreed with, aggressive communication from top down
-sexual harassment was literally treated like a joke in an agency wide meeting and also on day to day (greeting subordinates with hugs and kisses despite sexual harassment trainings/context)
-for some time exclusively hiring young, slender, female employees (no male, older/experienced applicants were given consideration)
-behaving defensively when staff brings up concerns or suggestions for improvement
-creating inappropriate after work events (happy hours and encouraging people to drink
-asking subordinates for personal favors during the work day- yes I watched a supervisor ask a subordinate to drive her son to the greyhound station
-nepotism 

The executive team is equally enmeshed with the toxicity at times, and has awarded those individuals with their highest recognitions. 

Pay is very low, expectations are high, and employees are explicitly told not to tell others if they are given a raise, meanwhile supervisors create more middle management positions to hand off their work whenever possible
Low pay, difficult to connect with people outside your team

pros: Positive environment, great people , a rewarding job.
cons: No cons. Important to be successful are attention to details and organization

pros: I feel like I'm making an impact on my community and am benefitting a vulnerable community. Benefits are great.
cons: They pay is lower than most in my industry. Pay is low for most functions in nonprofits. Children not included in paid-benefits.

pros: Everyone is very positive and will always provide support and help when needed. The job is very rewarding.
cons: There were not many areas for growth. There was a high case load which would sometimes become stressful.
Pay not high enough, hardly room for improvement/promotions unless someone quits

pros: Mission is central to the organization
cons: The compension v. workload leads to burnout.

pros: You never had to work OT
cons: Upper Management did not care if you were being bullied - swept under the rug.

pros: AnyBabyCan is the organization that I felt very proud to work for. Very warm culture with great leadership teams who are willing to help clients and employees. I am assured that this is the organization dedicated to help Austin community with passion.
cons: Because it is a non-profit organization, the financial situation is always challenging for the company. Therefore, employees should be available to bring up creative solutions to operate projects under limited financial ability.

pros: Very comfortable and convenient and very easy to work with them and is my pleasure to work with them i need to work under them till some time.they take very care of their workers and customers
cons: Too many hours and i want to know the condition on the work.
